lines.gurmukhi: jYsy AnI bwn kI rhq tUit dyhI ibKY cuMbk idKwey qqkwl inksq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Anee Baan Kee Rahat Tooti Dayhee Bikhai , Chounbak Dikhaaay Tatakaal Nikasat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as the tip of an arrow breaks inside the wound on the body and it is pulled out with the help of a magnet.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy jok qoNbrI lgweIq rogI qn AYc lyq ruDr biRQw smu Ksq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Jok Tonbaree Lagaaeet Rogee Tana , Aich Layt Rudhar Bridaa Samu Khasat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a leech is put on the boil of a patient that sucks out all the dirty blood and pus thus relieving the patient of the pain.

lines.gurmukhi: jYsy juviqn pRiq mrdn krY dweI grB sQMBn huie pIVw n gRsq hY
lines.transliteration_english: Jaisay Juvatin Prati Maradan Karai Daaee , Garabh Sadanbhan Hui Peerhaa N Grasat Hai ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Just as a midwife massages the stomach of a pregnant lady to relieve her of pain and discomfort.

lines.gurmukhi: qYsy pwNco dUq BUq ibBrm huie Bwig jwiq siqgur mMq jMq rsnw rsq hY ]365]
lines.transliteration_english: Taisay Paancho Doot Bhoot Bibharam Hui Bhaagi Jaati , Satigur Mant Jant Rasanaa Rasat Hai ?365?

Shabad OS B.translation: Similarly, he who has been blessed with the divine word by the True Guru to meditate on and he practices it ardently enjoying the elixir-like Naam with his tongue, is able to dispel the influence of the five demons i.e., lust, anger, attachment, greed and
